div.ab: [- - -] . . . speaking to my face through his nose, wishing to end my life, and if I had not obtained help from Pamoun my fellow villager, he would long since have reached (the end) of my life. Since I cannot endure (it) for this reason, I submit the petition to Your Diligence, testifying to these things and askind that they be brought before you, and (that you) carry out the legal consequences against them and that the possession and ownership of the building lot that belongs to me be preserved for me. Farewell.;In the year after the consulate of our masters Gratian for the fifth time and Theodosius for the first time, eternal Augusti, Pachon 10.;I, Aurelia Eirene, submitted (the petition). I, Aurelius Herakleides, son of Apollonios, wrote for her because she is illiterate.
